fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36300].
  {panel}

*Feedback from a customer:*

Whenever you run Indexing and for some reason it fails, you remove the existing working index and leave the system inoperable. It makes it look like all of the users have lost their data. In reality until you fix the index error, then everything comes back.

My suggestion is to:

Keep the existing working Index and only remove it when the current run is successful. If for whatever reason the current indexing run fails, then the system would still remain usable until the indexing error is corrected. You should be backing up the current working index in case the current indexing run fails.
I understand that the error has to be corrected but if you do what I suggest, then at least it doesn't cause a crisis for the JIRA Admins until the problem is fixed.
fields.summary: JIRA should backup current working index in case reindexing fails.

Thank you.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Replicate
Suppose you have Project A (PA) with *500 issues* and Project B (PB) with *800 issues*.

# Open a browser tab and run a filter in it (e.g. Project = PA) which returns 500 issues.
# Open a second browser tab and run a different query (e.g. Project = PB) which returns 800 issues.
# Go back to the previous tab (PA issues) and click on Bulk Change.
# The bulk change window will display *500 issues* from the last executed query, in this case, *Project B*.

This might cause users to accidentally bulk change (even delete) issues from the wrong project.
fields.summary: Bulk Change uses filter from navigation context instead of the one displayed in the UI

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36275].
  {panel}

Hi!

We use the Jira for project management and we adopt Category as "Customer".
Now I need migrate our defects management from Bugzilla to Jira.

In our process, components and versions are attributes of "products" (products are the systems resulting from our projects). In other words, we execute several projects to improve the same product!

I think that we should not duplicate all the versions and components configurations for each new project of the same product...

The subcomponents solution have the same problem... all structure (components/subcomponents) are exclusive to one unique project...

I think that if the Jira had projects hierarchy, we can use the level 1 as product and project level 1.1 as project, with components reuse (as the Mantis tool can do). Or something like it.

What's your current position about this issue JRA-12241?
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12241

What solution do you indicate to my need?

Thanks a lot!

fields.description:
Running an 'expensive' JQL on the Average Time in Status gadget can consume resources and cause long running threads and can cause JIRA to become unresponsive.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a gadget on a test dashboard for "Average Time in Status"
* Configure the gadget with the following settings:
** Filter: that returns ALL issues
** Statuses: select ALL status
** Period: Hourly
** Days Previously: 300 (which appears to be the maximum)
** Refresh Interval: Every 15 mins

h4. Expected Result
Results show

h4. Actual Results
JIRA server CPU utilization spikes and accessing administration pages is unresponsive.

The below is an example of the size of an instance that has experienced this:
{noformat}
___ Database Statistics ____________________

     Issues                                        : 258704
     Projects                                      : 438
     Custom Fields                                 : 131
     Workflows                                     : 48
     Users                                         : 5767
     Groups                                        : 9626
     Attachments                                   : 280911
     Comments                                      : 1077221
{noformat}

Is there some type of boundary limit or check that we can implement to prevent these 'expensive' queries from running?
fields.summary: Average Time In Status Gadget Causes High CPU Utilization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36249].
  {panel}

* When adding a new watcher, it is momentarily visible in the Watchers inline dialog, even when the server returns an error
* When opening the Watchers inline dialog, the previously added watcher is momentarily visible, even if the server returned an error.
* Sometimes the inline dialog jumps to the top-left corner (I can't reproduce that).

This is caused by the REST resource. When you add a watcher it optimistically adds it to the model, then fires off an XHR. If this XHR returns an error (eg. user does not have permission to view the issue/project) then the model isn't updated. This happens because the XHR doesn't return an error - it returns a 20x response, but without the user to remove.
fields.summary: On a slow connection, when adding watchers and there is an error, the new watcher is visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36248].
  {panel}

h4. +Current Scenario+
It's currently possible to integrate JIRA with a SSO tool - see [Single Sign-on Integration with JIRA and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Single+Sign-on+Integration+with+JIRA+and+Confluence]. However, JIRA will show any pages that do not require login (such as https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa). Which leads user to be rerouted to JIRA login page, instead of the SSO

h4. +Suggestion+
Add an option to JIRA's *General Configuration* to redirect any users that are not yet logged in to the SSO to the log in page in the SSO.

fields.description:
# Create a Jira ticket
# While creating the ticket, select someone other than yourself as the Reporter
# Save the ticket

+Expected Result+
On clicking 'Activity' at the bottom, it shows you as having created the ticket

+Actual Result+
'Activity' shows the person you made the Reporter as having created the ticket.

I can think of so many reasons why this is bad for auditing purposes.  The ability to create a bunch of defects with no traceability back to yourself is just not good.
fields.summary: Changing Reporter when creating ticket shows that person as the ticket creator

fields.description:
External gadgets do not work on JIRA 6.1.3 when Trusted Applications is configured between two applications. However, oAuth authentication seems to be working fine.

This issue can occur in a variety of gadgets (i.e. [Overdue Review gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Crucible+gadgets], [Confluence Page gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Page+Gadget]) among different products, follow is the description of how to replicate this issue with JIRA and Confluence.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA 6.1.3 and Confluence 5.3.4
# Configure 'Trusted Application' application link between the two applications
# Add "Show Confluence Page" gadget on JIRA
# You will face error on the gadget as example in [^gadget.jpg] with HTTP Status 401 Unauthorized Error.

If DEBUG is enabled on Confluence, the following will be thrown
{noformat}2013-12-10 18:11:10,724 DEBUG [http-8090-17] [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] setFailureHeader BAD_PROTOCOL_VERSION;	Unsupported protocol version: {0}. required {1};	["0","2"]
java.lang.RuntimeException: BAD_PROTOCOL_VERSION;	Unsupported protocol version: {0}. required {1};	["0","2"]
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator.setFailureHeader(TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator.java:247)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator.authenticate(TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator.java:73){noformat}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how your teams work and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We have decided to close this specific request for _additional status categories_ as Won't Fix. The finite set of status categories allows us to build useful features on top of them, like completion progress indicators for Epics and Versions.

We recognize that for many teams, most of the steps in a workflow are "In Progress" and that it can be difficult to distinguish them. Here are some strategies:
* Add additional columns to your board for different workflow states. You can have several "In Progress" columns to represent concepts like "In Development" or "Under Review".
* Use the card colors based on JQL queries feature ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-colours]) to define your own colors for workflow states. I've created this suggestion in the JIRA Agile project to improve this in the future: GHS-11666
* Use JIRA Agile card layouts (new in JIRA Agile 6.6) to show the workflow state on the card ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-fields])
* To customize the display of issues within the JIRA issue navigator, consider the free third-party [icnavigator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icnavigator.jira-icnavigator] from Interconcept GmbH.

We do not plan to support arbitrary colors for status categories. The mapping of blue, yellow, and green to "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" is part of [Atlassian's overall visual system|https://design.atlassian.com/latest/product/components/lozenges/]. Our intent is to improve how we use this pattern to communicate information in JIRA; however, we use the combination of colors and lozenges to represent concepts not only in JIRA, but across Atlassian's product suite.

Finally, there were specific requests for a "Red" status color. The main use case here was situations where an issue had progressed to the end of a workflow, but the resolution was negative (e.g. "Failed" instead of "Done"). In JIRA's structure, this connects the final workflow state (i.e. "Resolved") with the type of resolution. While there's certainly merit in this request, it has the potential to significantly increase JIRA's complexity.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

The new status colors in JIRA provides initial set of pre-defined statues. It would also be beneficial to add the ability for users to add more categories to it
fields.summary: Ability to add more categories to statuses

fields.description:
A user created a ticket in jira, which was moved to another section, where the creator of the ticket has no rights. But the creator recieved a notification in confluence about a new comment on the ticket, he was no longer able to read and the comment was quoted in confluence.

I think, this is a security flaw, because the comment should not show up in the notification list in confluence. Correctly there was no mail generated by the jira system.
fields.summary: Confluence notifications generated on jira issues no longer readable

fields.description: If a confluence instance is configured to pull notifications from a JIRA server then if a user 'B' (not in group 'A') watches an issue and a comment is added to the issue restricted to group 'A' then user 'B' is able to see the contents of the restricted comment via the "Notifications and Tasks" drawer in confluence.
fields.summary: Workbox (Notifications and Tasks) leaks restricted information from a jira issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36235].
  {panel}

It would be good to have the URL of the filter on issues clicked using this gadget. This can be accomplished by clicking on the number at the bottom of the filter, but then you have to find the issue on the next screen, and clicking on the number isn't intuitive to most users.

It would ideal if instead of:
https://menlolog.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-3316
.... it has:
https://menlolog.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-3316?filter=13632

Otherwise, if a user clicks on the issue and wants to see other issues in the filter, they have to click Back and wait for the dashboard to load again. This wastes a lot of time, especially in IE since dashboards load so slow there.

This seems like a very simple fix to include the filter name in the URL. Please see if this can be fixed.

Thanks.
fields.summary: When issues are clicked inside of Filter Results gadget, it should include the filter in the URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36233].
  {panel}

When creating a project and board in JAG on On Demand with scripts in the board name and project name, an XSS vulnerability was found.
[screenshot]

Steps to reproduce:

# Click on Agile > Getting Started
# Click on Create a new board button
# Select "New project and a new board"
# Enter a XSS string (e.g. <script>alert(1)</script>) in Project name. Fill all the other fields with any values
# Select Agile Simplified Workflow (recommended)
# When the dialog "Creating and linking companions for your JIRA project" is rendered, you'll get the alert (x)
fields.summary: XSS in Create Project dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36230].
  {panel}

In the following article:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email

It is mentioned:

{quote}Issues and comments in JIRA can be generated either from:
* email messages sent to an account on a POP or IMAP mail server, or
* messages written to the file system generated by an external mail service.{quote}

but it is not evident that JIRA needs to first be configured with a POP3 or IMAP server, [as is clearly mentioned in this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+to+Receive+Email+from+a+POP+or+IMAP+Mail+Server].

I think it should be as obviously the first article as it is the 2nd one I mentioned.

It is listed as a child page, but I feel that many customers might not see this.
fields.summary: Clarify Creating Issues with Email Entry

Thanks & Regards,

fields.description:
We discovered that REST API performance that returns issues based on the JQL filter is extremely slow, making it impossible to use if you want to export more than a few issues.

We have a project where we need to export the entire brief-list of issues (~20.000) in few seconds. Now this takes > 30 minutes ~ 1800 seconds

* brief list = key, issuetype, summary and components.

Because REST was useless, we implemented our own plugin that does exactly this in 5 seconds, which is more than 300x times faster. 

We didn't make any special tricks in order to get this performance so I guess that way REST API is implemented is the core problem.

{code}
curl -n -o rest-hp-6.json  -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jql":"project = HP","startAt":0,"maxResults":1000,"fields":["id","key","components","issuetype"],"expand":[]}'  "https://jira.example.com/rest/api/2/search"
{code}

Clearly there is something that increases the export time so much:

get 100 issues : ~3 seconds
get 500 issues : ~ 27 seconds
get 1000 issues: ~55 seconds
get 2000 issues: ~111 seconds

Based on this I would say that the performance for more than 200-300 is ~18 issues/second, which is extremely slow for a high-end machine, and obviously that's not a limit imposed by the load of the sever or database.

It's important to note that I did some testing regarding enabling or disabling gzip compression and it seems that it has no effect regarding timing.
fields.summary: Getting issue list via REST api has huge performance issues regardless number of fields requested or expand values

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36219].
  {panel}

JIRA issue navigator doesn't sort versions with the same name across multiple projects properly. The sorting will be done based on each project separately.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 projects with 2 versions in each projects using similar names e.g. v1 and V2.
# Create some issues in both projects and set the fix version to the versions created. Let's say 2 issues for *v1* and 2 issues for *v2* in both project - total up to 8 issues.
# Go to issue navigator. Search for all issues created.
# Sort by fix version.
# Check the sorted result for *v2*. It will listed out all *v2* and followed by *v1* from the same project before the next project's *v2* will be listed.
fields.summary: JIRA issue navigator doesn't sort versions with the same name across multiple projects

fields.description:
Dates are not displayed correctly.
Instead of "월"(2-Bytes), it displays a square box.
Probably, it tried to reduce month by 3 bytes for something like "Jan".
In my language, months don't have name, we keep "1월"(3-Bytes).

Also, in Y-Axis, I can't see the name of Y-Axis.
Probably, it was "일수"(4 bytes), means "Days".


Possible reason:
Unicode characters are not properly supported for the chart.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

<Project Width>
# Create a new project with a long name.
# Create a filter with any issues in it.
# Edit the current filter and Add Shares to a project and select the Long named project.

<Cascade Select>
# Create a Cascade Select Custom field.
# Make a long name value for the its value.
# Create an Issue and select the value.

*Expected Results:*
The list width will follow the most long value for both of the operation.

*Actual Results:*
The list width still following the default size and cuts the displayed value.

*Notes*
This might have been affecting all the drop down menu on the Internet Explorer 8, not just the operation above
fields.summary: Drop Down list Width on Filter Sharing and Cascade Select custom field is not following the length of the Value in IE8

fields.description:
With the following configuration  JIRA -> CROWD -> Delegated directory, users authentication in JIRA will always fail until the directory has been synchronized again after the first login. 

Step to replicate:
# Connect JIRA with crowd with delegated directory.
# Synchronise the crowd user directory from the JIRA side
# Login with the user from the crowd with delegated directory.

Expected Result
The login successful

The real result
login fail 

This is because the user group from the crowd with delegated directory was not synchronize in the first login. The username was added into the JIRA directory but it does not have any group membership.

The group membership will only appear when the directory was synchronize again after the user login.

Subsequent login for crowd user will succeed if they belong to the previously synchronize group.
fields.summary: JIRA with delegated LDAP directory connected through crowd does not auto synchronize user group in the first login.

fields.description:
When a user attempts to share an issue to a large number of users through the Share Issue button, the "share" button will move below the screen and will be unclickable. If the user tries to scroll the whole page downwards, the Share Issue dialog closes automatically. 
(There is no way for the user to click on the share button) 

IE, Firefox, Chrome are all affected. Here is a screencast to better illustrate the problem: http://screencast.com/t/NmfSOeCAv

This actually happens intermittently, sometimes you can scroll the page without it closing the Share Issue dialog box (thus you can click on the Share button), but sometimes it doesn't work.

*WORKAROUND:*
# Press on the "Enter" key on the *"User name or email"* text field to send out the share. (After you have added all your users to the list)
fields.summary: Share Issue dialog can't be scrolled
Request for a new JQL operator in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36194].
  {panel}

When logged in as a user with the username 'anonymous' and going to the Issue view, a dialog will pop up with the following message:
{quote}
*Session Expired*
It looks like your session has timed out, or you have been logged out of JIRA. You will need to log back in to continue.
{quote}

Clicking 'Log in again' causes the page to refresh and then presents the message again. Clicking 'ignore' allows the user to continue working on the issue until they leave the issue view and open another ticket or refresh the page.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user with the username 'anonymous'
# Log in as that user
# View an issue
*The _Session Expired_ error is shown*

*Workaround*
Rename the user

Occurs in both Download(6.2m4) and OnDemand (6.2-OD-3).
fields.summary: User with the username 'anonymous' is shown 'session expired' messages

This code in file IssueFinderImpl.java :
{code:java}
@Override
    public Issue findIssue(@Nonnull String issueIdOrKey, @Nonnull ErrorCollection errorCollection)
    {
        if (isIssueId(issueIdOrKey))
        {
            return findIssueById(Long.parseLong(issueIdOrKey), errorCollection);
        }
        return findIssueByKey(issueIdOrKey, errorCollection);
    }
{code}

Must be replace by :
{code:java}
    @Override
    public Issue findIssue(@Nonnull String issueIdOrKey, @Nonnull ErrorCollection errorCollection)
    {
        if (isNotBlank(issueIdOrKey) && isIssueId(issueIdOrKey))
        {
            return findIssueById(Long.parseLong(issueIdOrKey), errorCollection);
        }
        if (isNotBlank(issueIdOrKey)) {
            return findIssueByKey(issueIdOrKey, errorCollection);
        }
        errorCollection.addErrorMessage(authContext.getI18nHelper().getText("rest.issue.key.or.id.required"));
        return null;
    }
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36192].
  {panel}

When i access _url2jira_/charts then i get NullPointerException.
This is caused by me not giving arguments to DisplayChartsServlet and in the source of DisplayChartServlet someone trying to create a java.io.File with null argument.

h4. Error in log
{noformat}
2013-12-13 11:16:53,565 http-bio-8443-exec-25 ERROR      [500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:291)
	at com.atlassian.jira.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet.service(DisplayChartServlet.java:61)
{noformat}

h4. How to reproduce
# In your own test jira
## go to address https://mylocaljira*/charts*
# in Atlassians live jira (Caution, it pollutes your live logs with NPE-s)
## go to url https://jira.atlassian.com/charts

h4. How to fix?
To fix that you should just add null check to *com.atlassian.jira.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet*

h4. Affected versions
My affected system is 6.0.4 and also i tested on THIS live jira (i hope that i logged its version correctly)
fields.summary: NullPointerException while trying to access /charts

fields.description:
Hi,
We have JIRA configured to where if an email is sent to a certain email address, a JIRA entry is automatically created.  However, many people have email signatures with graphics.  JIRA sees these as attachments and adds them to the JIRA issue.  After several email exchanges in an issue, this can get very cluttered.  Is there a way to prevent this?  We often use screenshots in our JIRA issues, so we can't filter by file type.
fields.summary: Email signature graphics attaching to JIRA issues

I have a Post-Function in the Workflow to set the Resolution to "Complete" (this is not the default, could this be the cause?).
This transition also fires a Issue Resolved Event.

However, when the issues follow the workflow, the resolution is never set. I can set it manually.

This does not work for the subtasks either.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36180].
  {panel}

When an Atlassian add-on adds a service to the services in JIRA, usually it uses the class name as the name for the service
Examples:
*Subversion add-on:*
*Name*=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.revisions.scheduling.UpdateIndexMonitorImpl:job
*Class*=com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginSchedulerService
*Bamboo add-on:*
*Name*=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.service.PlanStatusUpdateServiceImpl:job
*Class*=com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginSchedulerService

These names can be hard to find for some users when they are trying to edit the value for a service related to a specific plugin.

It would be great if the service names are actually names that mean what the service is supposed to be, like our Backup Service and Mail Queue Service
fields.summary: Clearer names for Atlassian add-ons services

h2. Steps to replicate:

It does not affect instance that have small indexes, as the indexing complete before the issue creation timeout.
 # Generate 30 thousand issues
 # Perform background reindex
 # Attempt issue creation, noticed error
 # Wait for another while (highly depending on the size of the instance where indexing of issue has been done), noticed the issue is created.

This could be crucial for the large instance and as stated on our documentation, the only downfall is that indexing is slower to complete but user can still use JIRA as per normal, but issue creation took a long while which gives impression that the issue is not created.
{quote}JIRA can be used by users during re-index.
{quote} * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Search+Indexing]

Hardware Specification during the verification of the Bug:
 * 64-bit "Fourth Generation" Intel Mobile Core i7 "Haswell/Crystalwell" (I7-4750HQ) 2.0GHz
 * SSD (Solid State Drive) with Read Speed 700Mbps/ Write Speed 400Mbps

h2. Expected Result

All operation on the instance should be possible and not impacted by the background reindex
h2. Actual Result
 * Sometimes the issue creation spins indefinitely and it stop loading, even though the issue is actually created.
 * For Cloud instances, the creation might hit into 60 seconds proxy timeout and run into page unavailable error
fields.summary: Background Reindex Causes Issue Creation To Be Created Slower with Error
Ability to apply database modification without JIRA restart.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36174].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. On the View Issue page, drag and drop an attachment into the drag/drop area on the right
2. Wait in a confused state while you wonder whether it's actually working or not
3. See that the attachment did indeed upload
fields.summary: When dragging and dropping an attachment, provide feedback that it's actually uploading something

fields.description:
The issue navigator makes a REST request to {{rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} when it loads. This request is expected to respond with an array of objects with filter data in them.

!normal-request-data.png|thumbnail!

If this REST request fails -- e.g., gives a non-200 response, times out, or contains something that isn't an array -- then the issue navigator stops working properly.

!failed-request.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue navigator stops working if favourite filters can't be retrieved
